instructions.1: Stir together 1/2 cup tomato sauce, pepperoni, oregano and pepper flakes in medium bowl. Add beef; mix together and shape mixture into 4 patties, about 1/2-inch thick.
instructions.2: Heat large skillet over medium-high heat. Add patties; cook 5 minutes on each side or until cooked through (160 degrees F). Top each with 1 slice cheese; melt slightly. Remove from heat.
instructions.3: Spread 1 tablespoon tomato sauce on bottom half of each bun. Top each with a patty. Spoon remaining tomato sauce evenly over patties. Close with tops of buns. Serve immediately.

questions.question: In Step 3, is the patties from Step 2 being used?
Is patties from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is patties from Step 2 still available in Step 3?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 2?
If we skip Step 2, is it still valid to use the patties in Step 3?
Can we stir (Step 1) and spread (Step 3) at the same time?
